steps.label: Collection
steps.desc: Water hyacinth, bagasse and recycled paper are collected locally.

steps.label: Processing
steps.desc: Materials are processed to meet standards before forming.

steps.label: Molding

steps.label: Packing & distribution
steps.desc: Finished products are inspected, packed and delivered.

about.title: About the project
about.body: GreenShield Mekong turns water hyacinth and local by‑products into bio-based fruit packaging. Our goals are to cut plastic waste, clean rivers, and create sustainable livelihoods while meeting export logistics and traceability needs. Primary customers are farm cooperatives and exporters seeking greener, cost-effective packaging.

environment.title: Environment
environment.desc: Bio materials that naturally degrade and reduce plastic waste.

export.title: Export-ready
export.desc: Durable design that meets logistics tests and traceability.

jobs.desc: Sourcing from farmers and creating stable community employment.

coop.title: Co-op collaboration
coop.desc: Partner with local cooperatives to collect and pre-process hyacinth — prioritizing rural women and vulnerable workers.

training.desc: Provide production and quality management training to local partners.

digital.desc: QR → fanpage/website to tell the ‘Made in Mekong’ story to young consumers.
